title: The News Beyond The COVID Numbers
description: Throughout the coronavirus pandemic, numbers have been flying at us about the spread of the illness—and then the next minute those same numbers are refuted. This week, we're talking to Alexis Madrigal at The Atlantic about why the data is so all over the place, and why that matters, especially for people of color.

itunes:title: The News Beyond The COVID Numbers
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: This week, we're shifting focus from census numbers to the numbers that everyone is obsessed with right now: coronavirus data, and how it breaks down by race.
